headline: Holiday Chicken Salad
description: Dried cranberries add a sweet tartness to chicken and vegetable salad. Make a delightful sandwich filling, too.

video.description: The cranberries provide the seasonal punch to this tasty salad.
video.name: Holiday Chicken Salad

name: Holiday Chicken Salad

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, mix together mayonnaise with paprika and seasoned salt. Blend in dried cranberries, celery, bell pepper, onion, and nuts. Add chopped chicken, and mix well. Season with black pepper to taste. Chill 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: Very good and it received rave reviews served in small croissant rolls at a holiday party for women. I adjusted the recipe to half. I used half Mayo and half sour cream instead of all mayonnaise and added chopped pecans. May use walnuts next time. It made a dozen sandwiches.

I love this recipe. It manages to be both elegant and comforting. It's a new classic. I did soak the cranberries before adding them to the salad and added half a cup more of mayo. I also halved the celery stalks before chopping them for a more subtle celery flavor. I've added a small garlic clove for more flavor, with excellent results. I've also substituted walnuts for the pecans, and it worked beautifully. I like that this salad uses cubed chicken instead of shredded chicken. My whole family loves this salad, and it's been requested repeatedly for family gatherings.
Wonderful! Easy to prepare. Everyone enjoyed the flavor combinations. Appearance very nice, too.
I made this exactly as the recipe . I love it ! I use to buy cranberry pecan chicken salad from Sams Club , but no more .
Great recipe. I did substitute chopped green apples for the green peppers and added a handful of halved purple grapes. Made the finished salad even prettier!
Added cowboy jalapeños and wow, new fav
Great chicken salad. Family is very picky and they loved it. I made it exactly as the recipe states. Yummy!

This is an incredibly delicious recipe. I’ve made it a few times now. I took the advice of another reviewer to soak the dried cranberries in water prior to putting them in and it was really great advice. It prevented them from taking in too much of the moisture from mayo/dressing, causing the salad to become too dry. It tastes great just after making it but it is even better 24 hours later. Thanks for the recipe!
I’ve made this amazing salad many times. I’ve used it with leftover turkey also.
I make this quite frequently. It's fantastic. A really exquisite chicken salad recipe, not just for holidays.
Really good salad simply made. Lots of healthy mixtures in it. Yumms
I liked it but Jerry didn’t.

Super easy. I’m not a huge chicken salad fan, but this is great. I omit the green pepper and really just mix enough of the ingredients to my personal liking but this is a great base recipe for sure! Ps the green onion really makes it.
I added more mayo than called for in the recipe and it was excellent.
Made this salad as directed. It was easy and so delicious. It will be my go to recipe from now on. Thanks for sharing it.
Wonderful chicken salad. I will make this again. Very easy to add or omit and make it with what you have on hand.
One of the best chicken salad’s I’ve had. Thanks

I followed the recipe almost exactly as described (my wife loves avocados so I added them). I believe the next time I make this I will reduce the mayo just a tad. Other than that it was a great way to use left-over chicken.
Made it exactly as the recipe said for Xmas luncheon. It was delicious and everyone raved that it was the best chicken salad they had ever had.

Should probably have included some notes about chicken seasoning. I went with: apple cider vin, salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, thyme, oregano, and parsely

Add some red wine vinegar and water to mayo (and whip it) to smooth it out. 

And I go with red onion over green onion.

Don't be shy with the paprika.
This is amazing! It does not need any adjustments!!! It is the best chicken salad that I have ever tasted just as it is!!
Great! Loved the addition of dried cranberries! Did not add nuts - digestion issue... Will make again soon (used rotisserie chicken) which really is the best!
This was amazing. I already had grapes so I used those. Yum yum

Made to the recipe, using sliced almonds instead of pecans. Found it a bit bland and dry to my tastes, so added some more mayo, poultry seasoning, Old Bay and garlic powder. Great for wraps/sandwiches.
Don’t like green pepper, so omitted that. I also did not have green onions, so I just added onion powder. I added small apple chunks. Easy and delicious!
This was great everyone loved it I used it for sliders.

Great recipe! I used a Costco rotisserie chicken & found the recipe to be a bit dry & bland for my taste. However, after adding a bit of spicy Italian dressing & garlic, black & red pepper I found it was delicious. I added green grapes & substituted toasted almonds for the pecans and served on toasted crescents w fruit. My book club loved it!

Everyday is a Holiday! This chicken salad is awesome!
My family loves it, asks for it!
I’ve memorized the recipe!
Neither my fiancé nor I liked this. I'm not sure exactly what about it we didn't like. I had such high hopes but it was a flop for us.
So stinking delicious!!!
I have made this at least a dozen times. It is amazing. I make it as is, except no green pepper, which is my personal taste. This is a true "go to" recipe. Everyone loves this when I make it.
Would make again, left out green pepper. No leftovers.
It turned out great. Lots of compliments.
I have made this several times through the years for an annual holiday luncheon. It always receives compliments and the group is disapointed when I don't bring it. Thank you for the wonderful recipe.
I left out the peppers, added Greek yogurt and chopped pecans. Husband loved it! This is a keeper!
This was really good! I made it as is, but I did roast the pecans for more flavor. I baked up some fresh croissants, and it was so good! It made a really yummy sandwich.
I served this 3 times during the holidays so far--I believe less seasoned salt was preferred by my guests for the 2nd-3rd serving and just as flavorful!

I ave made this once before and it was dynamite!! I made it today and did not have enough dried cranberries so I added a crisp apple and raisins and it is awesome. Can wait for the flavors to blend. Love this recipe. Thank you for sharing!
Delicious! My guests enjoyed it, best if served with croissants!

I used a rotisserie chicken, which made it so much easier. I omitted the onions out of taste preference and added a honey crisp apple and green grapes. I think this recipe is good as is though and easily modified.

Since there is only 2 of us, I divided the recipe to 1/4 of the original. Didn't have green onions, so I used sweet onions, and red peppers instead of green peppers, and had craisins on hand so I used those. It was wonderful. The texture combination of the craisins, celery, chicken and pecans made it very interesting to eat. The flavor was wonderful. I'm sure it would be just as good with the original ingredients, but I was able to use what I had on hand with no problem. Will definitely use this recipe again, as it is now my new favorite chicken salad.

So easy, but really good! A nice surprise. Took it to a potluck and it was almost gone at the end. I used 2% Greek Key Lime yogurt. It was thick and did not get runny on the bottom of the bowl. I used 3 containers for 12 servings. It’s a keeper.

I have made this recipe loads of times and love it! Usually I make it when we are tired if eating plain leftover chicken. I have substituted almost everything and it is still good but the original recipe is best. Definitely leave it overnight for best flavor.

Bomb Diggity!
I have used the pecans but good with or without. I like sage in there too. Filling and Delish!

Love it! Like other reviewers, I tweaked the additional ingredients a bit. I substituted fresh grapes for the dried cranberries (not a fan), and got rid of the green pepper altogether. Perhaps the addition of the fresh grapes helped to combat the dryness that others mentioned? Not sure. I felt it had plenty of flavor between the add-ins and the paprika to be delicious. I've served this to dozens of people and have gotten rave reviews from them.
Just made it, just put it on bread, and it’s yummy! Thank you.
Added chopped apple, didn’t have any bell pepper, still awesome!
I LOVE this recipe, it is one of my new favorites and we will definitely be making it again sometime soon!

This was a great recipe, and simple. I, too, like others, have made a version with halved grapes and crushed pineapple, leaving out the green onion and pepper. The addition of Green Godess or Cucumber Ranch adds a refreshing flavor.
Fantastic . Yes I'll make it again and again.

I have taken this recipe to a couple church functions so far and it had gotten rave reviews both times. Afterwards, my husband hogs the leftovers! :)

Thank you for sharing this recipe.
Great

This is the best chicken salad ever. A local deli served an excellent chicken salad, which I had for lunch at least twice a week. Then it closed and I began to search for a similar recipe. This is it!! I usually use 1/2 cup of mayonnaise and 1/2 cup Miracle Whip. Yummy!
My husband likes this. Asks for it a lot. I make 1/2 recipe using one cooked chicken breast and substituting sweet onion for the green onions.
I had my doubts because the recipe was so simple. Absolutely amazing. High five!!!
Excellent! Currently a staple in our home

Our family really enjoys this recipe. I have made it a few times. We usually put it on green leaf lettuce and eat it like a wrap. Today I was missing the bell pepper, green onion, and we were short on the cranberries. In place, I used extra celery, and used dried cherries to have enough of the dried fruit. I usually make it AS is, and this is a great recipe. The only I recommend is if you need it to be lower sodium, you could cut the seasoned salt in half and it would be yummy, yummy in your tummy! IF you find it bland: 1. you need to let it set so the flavors can meld, 2. check your spices, they may be expired or open too long (spices lose their intensity/flavor over time. Also, it does not state what kind of paprika to use, so I use a smoked paprika.

Excellent Chicken Salad and easy to adjust to your liking. Easy to make and a wonderful balance of flavors. Even my husband enjoyed it and I thought he would not care for the cranberries and pecans! The only changes I made were using Just Mayo (I cannot have eggs), didn't have green onions and added a little chopped fresh chives. I used half the amount of pecans called for in the recipe and toasted them, and it was perfect amount for the chicken salad. Also used a red bell pepper as we do not care too much for green bell pepper. Next time I will use a little less cranberries though as it seemed a little too sweet for us. Hubs had his on a croissant and I used a gluten free tortilla wrap. This will definitely be kept in the rotation when we have some chicken to use up or during the summer months! Thanks for the recipe!

Awesome Excellent Great! Perfect ratios! Texture and taste everyone loved even kids! Used Big Boy seasoning salt as it has touch of curry which is great w/ fruit- was out of some ingredients so made these substitutions : No green pepper 1/2 tsp onion powder ( scallions) slivered almonds (pecans) and a small apple ( cranberries). Great for lunch or dinner ! This would be wonderful at a shower or brunch too! Simple yet lots of flavors!! Also for new cooks your brand of mayo makes a big difference they are NOT all the same - my grandma swore by Hellman's and so do I!! I used leftover chicken breast I had baked in parchment paper with Old Bay seasoning, garlic salt, and butter -
Excellent and easy!

Delicious! As is (made it as is first time but without nuts) 5 stars. But I liked it better when I used more celery, Bells seasoning instead of seasoning salt, and skipped the bell pepper. And it was phenomenal when I used leftover chicken from this site (Grilled rosemary chicken breasts by Semigourmet). I still have a bunch of that chicken leftover and I'm going to chop and freeze it so I have on hand next time I want this chicken salad. This recipe is fantastic!
Fantastic

This recipe was easy to follow. I marinated my chicken before frying it down to add in. I also added 1/2 onion and then half and half miracle whip and mayo. Very good for my first time, will definitely make again.

Incredibly tasty. I was quite worried about how all of the ingredients would blend and almost left some out. So glad I didn’t. This recipe makes for one of the best chicken salads I’ve ever tasted!!! I changed absolutely nothing. I enjoy absolutely everything about it. Well done!
This was very simple and delicious recipe. I added sea salt, grapes, sweet relish and used sweet onions. My picky husband loved it!
I did not use the nuts and we were out of celery but it was good just the same
Amazingly delicious and festive! Hit the spot after all the holiday fare...very savory. Used frozen cranberries and added golden raisins because I had no Craisins.

Excellent chicken salad! So much better than anything you'd get from the store. I left out the green pepper because I didn't think I'd like it here. I added just a touch of garlic powder and poultry seasoning. I'd try replacing the cranberries with cut-up grapes another time. Thanks for the great recipe!
Made it just as the recipe said and holy cow this is good chicken salad!

This has been my go-to recipe for years. It was great as written, but I do adapt it now for my family's tastes.

We omit the green onions and green pepper, and substitute cut up grapes for the cranberries. I love that it's adaptable to what we have on hand and what everyone likes. 

If you toast the pecans, that also adds a great dimension to the flavor!

This is a delicious salad for sandwiches, especially on croissants! I have made it at least a half dozen times, always to rave reviews. The only substitution I make is yellow bell pepper instead of green, just because I prefer the yellow.
Exceptional!

This recipe used way too much paprika. All you could taste was paprika and it ruined the recipe. If you make it, definitely cut back on the paprika unless it is your favorite flavor because it is all you will taste.

I love the base idea. I adapted to be vegan and nutfree to accommodate my family's dietary restrictions (using vegan mayo and Gardien Chixn strips.) Served on potato kaiser rolls. Everyone asked for seconds.

This is a fantastic chicken salad recipe. I did make a few minor changes: I omitted the green pepper and onion. I added only 3/4 cup dried cranberries and 1 tsp each of honey and curry powder. I'm not really

The only change I made was leaving out the green pepper as I was serving to someone with an allergy. This made a great item on the buffet that people added to a salad or made a sandwich according to preference and gluten needs. Everyone loved it and it was all gone by the end! Will definately make this again!

Delicious! I left out the bell peppers, used rotisserie chicken and toasted the pecans. It's a great recipe. Even better if made 1-2 days in advance. We served on club cracker and Hawaiian rolls with a little extra mayo. A*
Used rotisserie chicken. Added a 1/2 tsp curry powder and a bit of garlic powder. Used 1/4c vidalia onion since I didn't have green. Excellent recipe.

Have had similar in a broccoli salad. The differences are the addition of broccoli, raisins instead of cranberries, and addition of bacon. If you prefer something with a little more sweet or kick, add pineapple. I cooked the chicken in a slow cooker
It turned out far better than I expected! Of course, I should not be surprised since this recipe has such high ratings
This is seriously the best chicken salad ever! Taking the time to shred the chicken rather than chopping makes it prettier and tastier.
Pretty good, I used Greek yogurt instead of mayo because mayo is gross to me haha. And used shredded chicken as well. Pretty good stuff.
I would probably add more onion and salt/seasoning and cut back a little on the cranberries next time. But it is a good salad. Will definitely make again.
This is awesome! We love it!
Great recipe for leftover roasted chicken. I used Mrs. Dash's roasted chicken seasoning instead of season salt. Better chicken salad than I can buy anywhere!

I took this to a "girls luncheon" and it was a major hit! The hostess was recovering from a foot injury so I offered her to keep some leftovers for dinner and she took all the rest! I made it the day before so the flavors would blend and it did taste even better than the day I made it. I used scallions instead of onion and added halved red seedless grapes as well. I used slivered almonds instead of pecans because it is what I had. I know this recipe would be delicious as stated, but I do think the grapes added something extra special. Because I was adding them I did increase the dressing recipe by 1/4 more. I have tried 2 other chicken salad recipes that wasn't what I was looking for but this one is a top notch recipe.
Delicious and simple. This recipe is a huge hit throughout the year!

The salad is awesome!!! Real hit! I have some modifications: I don't add celery. Instead of pecans I add walnuts. And I add only 2 table spoon of mayonnaise and for the rest I add yogurt (Greek yogurt). So, I make it a little bit lighter... Really wonderful taste.
Delicious chicken salad recipe for anytime of the year. This is a light, sweet salad recipe that is a hit for everyone. I left out the nuts but kept everything else the same.

absolutely delicious, we used a rotisserie chicken from publix and used more vegetables than it asked for to add more crunch. a good tip is to use the skin from the rotisserie chicken, I chopped it into small pieces and baked it first to get it crispy then added it at the end. I definitely recommend doing that!

I added a little cayenne for some subtle heat to go with all that sweet and some chopped apple to make up for my shortage of cranberries. I toasted the pecans. Other than that, I stayed true to the recipe.

A technique I use is to mix the seasonings with the mayo first. Toss the chicken into the dressing and blend completely. When coated add the rest of the dry ingredients. The dry ingredients get dressed but lighter. Their true flavors stand out and their colors pop. Beautiful and delicious!

By far my favorite chicken salad recipe. I added toasted pecans and diced apple and followed the recipe exactly. Have received many rave reviews about it. It's so different from the usual, much more savory.
This is one of the best chicken salad recipes I've ever made! I don't always like fruit in my chicken salad, but this had a perfect balance and crunch to it.
so very good. i used ground cooked chicken and added celery seed and no onions or peppers. I soaked the crans to plump them. absolutely delicious !
I absolutely love this one. I make a very nice addition to it; I place it on crunchy baguette slices, and what a taste!
Very good chicken salad. I added sweet pickle relish, chopped pecans and crumbled bacon. Made it even better.

Outstanding. This is my go to recipe for left over chicken. The only change I made was to soak the cranberries in whiskey for a few hours. Soaking the cranberries takes this chicken salad to the next level. Thank you.
I made this with leftover turkey! Excellent, will be making this every year with leftover thanksgiving turkey. This is super easy to make and delicious.

I had to modify a few things due to my allergy to bell peppers and raw onions. I lightly sauted some chopped onions, let them cool, and to replace crunch added some chopped carrots in place of the cell peppers. I didn't modify the spices. I also used a rotisserie chicken to save time. The flavor of this chicken salad was wonderful and everyone very much enjoyed this.
